TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi beforefieldinit ParameterBuilder extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.InteropServices._ParameterBuilder

remarks.format:
## Remarks Parameter attributes need to consistent with the method signature. If you specify `Out` attributes for a parameter, you should ensure that the type of that method parameter is a `ByRef` type.
Some <xref:System.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder> attributes require that you call <xref:System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder.DefineMethod%2A> with viable parameters in order for the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) to work correctly at runtime. For example, if you define a <xref:System.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder> with ParameterAttributes.Out for parameter 1 of a `MethodBuilder`, then parameter 1 of <xref:System.Reflection.Emit.MethodBuilder> must be a reference such as Type.GetType("System.String&"), rather than Type.GetType("System.String").
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a dynamic method with a parameter passed by reference using `ParameterBuilder`.
[!code-cpp[System.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Reflection.Emit.ParameterBuilder Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetConstant (object defaultValue);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetConstant(object defaultValue) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub SetConstant (defaultValue As Object)
public: virtual void SetConstant(System::Object ^ defaultValue);
abstract member SetConstant : obj -> unit override this.SetConstant : obj -> unit

Docs.param: The default value of this parameter.
Docs.summary: Sets the default value of the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `defaultValue` is restricted to the following types: `Boolean`, `SByte`, `Int16`, `Int32`, `Int64`, `Byte`, `UInt16`, `UInt32`, `UInt64`, `Single`, `Double`, `DateTime`, `Char`, `String`, and `Enum`. If the parameter type is a reference type, CLS compliance requires `defaultValue` to be `null`. However, starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], `defaultValue` can be non-null for a reference type as long as the value can be assigned to that reference type. For example, an `Int32` value can be assigned to a parameter of type <xref:System.Object>. This is not CLS-compliant, but it can be useful in interop scenarios.

Docs.exception:
The parameter is not one of the supported types.
-or-
The type of does not match the type of the parameter.
-or-
The parameter is of type or other reference type, is not , and the value cannot be assigned to the reference type.

Docs.summary: Set a custom attribute using a specified custom attribute blob.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the metadata specification in the ECMA Partition II documentation for details on how to format `binaryAttribute`. The documentation is available online; see [ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=99212) on MSDN and [Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65552) on the Ecma International Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method should throw the following exception but currently does not:
<xref:System.InvalidOperationException> if the containing type has been created using TypeBuilder.CreateType().

MemberSignature.Value: void _ParameterBuilder.GetIDsOfNames (ref Guid riid, IntPtr rgszNames, uint cNames, uint lcid, IntPtr rgDispId);

.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Runtime.InteropServices._ParameterBuilder.GetIDsOfNames([in]valuetype System.Guid& riid, native int rgszNames, unsigned int32 cNames, unsigned int32 lcid, native int rgDispId) cil managed
Sub GetIDsOfNames (ByRef riid As Guid, rgszNames As IntPtr, cNames As UInteger, lcid As UInteger, rgDispId As IntPtr) Implements _ParameterBuilder.GetIDsOfNames

virtual void System.Runtime.InteropServices._ParameterBuilder.GetIDsOfNames(Guid % riid, IntPtr rgszNames, System::UInt32 cNames, System::UInt32 lcid, IntPtr rgDispId) = System::Runtime::InteropServices::_ParameterBuilder::GetIDsOfNames;

Docs.param: Reserved for future use. Must be IID_NULL.
Passed-in array of names to be mapped.
Count of the names to be mapped.
The locale context in which to interpret the names.
Caller-allocated array which receives the IDs corresponding to the names.
Docs.summary: Maps a set of names to a corresponding set of dispatch identifiers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code. For more information about `IDispatch::GetIDsOfNames`, see the MSDN Library.

Docs.exception: The method is called late-bound using the COM IDispatch interface.
